siteMetadata.title: rantum.dev
siteMetadata.subtitle: digital dwelling of andrew maury. digital developer @ecomloop in burlingame, ca. san matean nantucketer on a rantum scoot.

frontmatter.title: Appreciate best of others
frontmatter.description: Bring good energy and help others with their struggles. Find ways to appreciate the good from others. Work to be better for others.

frontmatter.title: Short term bursts
frontmatter.description: Sometimes it takes short term bursts to get mometum going, especially when the goal feels far away. Push through, find energy, keep going.

frontmatter.title: Escaping black days
frontmatter.description: These are harder to notice in real time, because no single event seems _that bad_. Instead, the change is finally noticed when taking a new perspective. Getting back on track requires big changes rather than trying to nudge back on track.

frontmatter.title: Small wins repeated
frontmatter.description: Spend more on the little things that bring small wins. Many of the big wins are gone for now. No travel, no events, no dinners out with friends.

frontmatter.title: Work through physical pain
frontmatter.description: Get mind involved elsewhere. Approach it like the problem it is.

frontmatter.title: Prevent mistakes from compounding
frontmatter.description: Mistakes will happen. Acknowledge mistakes when they happen. Reassess and make better decisions going forward. Don't let mistakes compound. Recover quickly.

frontmatter.title: Take time for joy to inject new energy
frontmatter.description: Finding joy takes work sometimes. That's not a reason not to do it. Use joy + relaxation to inject energy into projects.
